intro: Gulubiopsis palauensis, commonly known as the Palau ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic orchid species native to the island of Palau in the Western Pacific. It is characterized by its delicate, pale pink or white flowers and slender, epiphytic growth habit, often found growing on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fragrant blooms during the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered critically endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species from threats such as habitat loss and climate change.
